The Bemba language is an official language in Zambia and is used in schools, government offices, and other public institutions. It is also used in the media, including radio, television, and newspapers. The Bemba language has a rich history and culture, and it is an important part of the identity of the Bemba people. ref_text: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults.
hyp_text: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a disease of the central nervous system (brain, optic nerves and spinal cord). The immune system attacks the protective covering of the nerves (myelin) in the central nervous system. This disrupts the normal flow of information within the brain, between the brain and the body and within the spinal cord itself. MS affects approximately 400,000 people in the United States, and the incidence of the disease is increasing. MS is not contagious, but it is more common in people who have a family history of the disease. Women are three times more likely to develop MS than men. The cause of MS is unknown. MS is not a fatal disease. Most people with MS have periods of relapses and remissions, but the disease can become progressive. MS is not a mental illness. MS is not a form of cancer.
